dialogNodes.dialogText:
YOU: "I wanted to ask about your feelings. How are you doing?"

FARMER LEADER: "Things are alright, my liege. As always, the soil provides~."

YOU: "How are things progressing with the tasks you've been assigned? What is your assessment of current production?"

FARMER LEADER: "Well, my liege. Hoping we can get just a little more out of the farms than last time, but we'll see."

YOU: "I'd like to know your opinion of me, actually. What are your thoughts?"

FARMER LEADER: "You're a fine leader, my liege. I'm sure you're doing what you can. Can't fault you for that."

YOU: "I was wondering if there was anything I could do to assist you, actually."

FARMER LEADER: "Ah, actually, would you mind plucking out some of those weeds over there?"

[Putting on some gloves, changing your boots, and walking out into the fields alongside the other citizens, you tend to the vegetation growing there. You get some odd looks from the common folk, but they wouldn't dare turn away help. Especially not Your help.]

YOU: "How are things between you and the Merchants?"

FARMER LEADER: "Crafty lads, I've gotta say. I suppose we could learn a thing or two from the way they handle business..."

YOU: "What are your thoughts on the soldiers?"

FARMER LEADER: "They keep us safe and I ought not to ask for much more. I think I'll bring them a pie one of these days..."

YOU: "How is your relationship with the smithies?"

FARMER LEADER: "They make our tools and utensils and homes. Damn... Don't really know what we'd do without 'em."

YOU: "How do you feel about the scholars?"

FARMER LEADER: "They can read and count real well. I envy 'em a little bit, I guess."

YOU: "I need you and your subordinates to work a little harder. We need more food. The people are hungry."

FARMER LEADER: "We can only ask so much from the soil, my liege... But, I'll see what can be done."

YOU: "You and your subordinates may work less, should you need the rest. We have enough food in storage for now."

FARMER LEADER: "Really? I'll let everyone know. I'm sure they'll be glad to get a little more rest. Thank you, my liege."

YOU: "What am I paying you cretins for?! I need to see results! Bring me something new or I'll have the guards bring me your head!"

[The leader of the farmers quivers in fear before you. They proceed to bow their head low. Your personal bodyguard, a knight in full-plate, casts the frightened field worker an evil grin. They nearly faint.]

YOU: "What do you think of our city? I'd like to know your thoughts."

FARMER LEADER: "It's our home, my liege. I love it. I think everyone else would say the same."

YOU: "I've noticed a dip in production. Are you not pulling your weight?"

[The head farmer fidgets.]

FARMER LEADER: "I'm working myself to the bone, my liege! I don't know what you're talking about!"

YOU: "Did you think I would not notice the decline in your production? I will not tolerate corruption! Reveal your treachery!"

[The head farmer furrows their brow and speaks loudly and indignantly.]

FARMER LEADER: "My liege! How dare you accuse me of such a thing! I would never betray you!"

YOU: "It would appear that production is slipped below acceptable levels. Tell me, is everything alright?"

[The head farmer takes a deep breath, exhaling slowly before responding.]

FARMER LEADER: "...I'll be fine, my liege. Thank you for your inquiry."

[You intimidate your subordinate into entertaining your presence for a little longer. 

As you cast off an ominous presence and giving warning looks, the leader of the farmers appear to be a little fearful of what you may do...]

[You politely posture yourself, understanding of your subordinate's undoubtedly busy schedule. 

The head farmer appears to notice this and in recognition of your thoughtfulness, they relax their stance and smile. It would appear that they've decided to entertain your presence a little longer. Politness has its perks!]

[Using your natural charm, your subordinate's attention is re-affixed to your person. 

The leader of the farmers shifts somewhat uncomfortably as their gaze becomes glued to your body. They try to shake off the miasma of passion surrounding you, but it just doesn't seem to work. Entirely distracted by your powers of seduction, they won't be asking you to leave anytime soon...]
